definition[0]: to deliberately and gradually introduce a new subject into a conversation
example[0]: I’ll try to bring the conversation around to the subject of money.
definition[1]: to make someone become conscious again
example[1]: I slapped his face a couple of times to try to bring him round.
definition[2]: to manage to persuade someone to do something or to agree with you
example[2]: She won’t listen to me. Let’s see if Sue can bring her round.
example[3]: I’m sure I can bring him around to our point of view.
definition[3]: to bring someone or something to someone’s house
example[4]: I’ll bring the books around tomorrow.
